```{r}
  read_csv('weather_df.csv')
```

```{r}
weather_df
```

regressing tmax on tmin with bootstrapped samples 

"Weâ€™ll focus on a simple linear regression with tmax as the response and tmin as the predictor"

creating helper function
```{r}
weather_lm = function(df) {
  lm(tmax ~ tmin, data = df)
}
```

conducting bootstrap
```{r}
boot_straps = 
  weather_df |> 
  modelr::bootstrap(n = 5000)#  |> 
  # map(weather_lm)
  # broom::tidy()
```


```{r}
boot_straps |> pull(strap) |> first()
```


```{r}
weather_bootstrap = 
  weather_df |> 
  modelr::bootstrap(n = 5000) |> 
  mutate(
    models = map(strap, \(df) lm(tmax ~ tmin, data = df) ),
    results = map(models, broom::tidy)) |> 
  select(-strap, -models) |> 
  unnest(results)
```


```{r}
weather_bootstrap |> 
  ggplot(aes(x = estimate, fill = term)) + 
  geom_histogram() +
  facet_wrap(. ~ term, scales = "free")+ 
  theme(legend.position="none")
```
